Name: n-Octadecane
Description: Octadecane is a straight-chain alkane carrying 18 carbon atoms. It has a role as a bacterial metabolite and a plant metabolite.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) US Dept Agric; US Dept Agric, Agric Res Service. 1992-2016. Dr. Duke's Phytochemical and Ethnobotanical Databases. Octadecane. Available from, as of Nov 14, 2016: https://phytochem.nal.usda.gov/phytochem/search
plant_concentrations.Value: Octadecane detections in plants used in food and medicinal applications(1). /Octadecane/

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Al-Hassan JM et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 65: 646-53 (2000) (2) Al-Hassan JM et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 66: 646-52 (2001)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Barnacle samples collected from five locations in the Arabian Gulf had concentrations of octadecane ranging from trace to 410 ng/g(1). Catfish samples collected from seven locations in the Arabian Gulf had concentrations of octadecane ranging from <0.1 to 57 ng/g(2).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Bixiong Y et al; Chemosphere 68: 140-149 (2007) (2) Hori T et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 83: 455-461 (2009)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Octadecane was detected in 29 surficial sediment samples collected from various rivers and canals around Tianjin, China during July 2002(1). Octadecane was detected in sediment samples from the Shinano River in Japan at concentrations ranging from less than 0.1 to 61 ng/g(2).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Rushdi AI et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 49: 457-470 (2005)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: During winter 2002 soil and sand samples, from six locations in the Riyadh metropolitan area of Saudi Arabia, were examined for extractable organic matter; octadecane was detected at a relative concentrations between 0.01 to 12.15% (of total extractable organic matter) at five of six locations(1).
